Title.evidence: single-blind, parallel-arm, superiority randomized clinical trial

Trial_Design.evidence: single-blind, parallel-arm, superiority randomized clinical trial recruited patients undergoing colorectal cancer resection from September 7, 2015, through June 19, 2019.

Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing colorectal cancer resection from September 7, 2015, through June 19, 2019. Patients were followed up for 4 weeks before surgery and 4 weeks after surgery at 2 university-affiliated tertiary hospitals.

Intervention.evidence: Multimodal program involving exercise, nutritional, and psychological interventions initiated before (Prehab group) or after (Rehab group) surgery.

Objective.evidence: To assess the extent to which a prehabilitation program affects 30-day postoperative complications in frail patients undergoing colorectal cancer resection compared with postoperative rehabilitation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome included the Comprehensive Complications Index measured at 30 days after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 120 frail patients (Fried Frailty Index, ≥ 2) were randomized.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 120 frail patients (Fried Frailty Index, ≥ 2) were randomized.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 110 patients were included in the intention-to-treat analysis (55 in the prehabilitation [Prehab] and 55 in the rehabilitation [Rehab] groups).

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no between-group difference in the primary outcome measure, 30-day Comprehensive Complications Index (adjusted mean difference, –3.2; 95% CI, –11.8 to 5.3; P = .45).
